title: So Nice Place
review: Swargashram is the epicenter of all yoga and meditation centers in Rishikesh. Swarg Ashram offers hundreds of rooms and hall with facilities.

title: Ultimate place for spiritual growth
review: I visited my grandmother who lives here for 4 months. It's a nice place to sit and meditate by the Ganges. The ghats are clean, and so is the river. You can easily bathe from here without crowds. The evening Ganga Aarti is worth attending at least once in your lifetime. All food here is vegetarian, with many cafes serving international flavours. You can visit saints and listen to lectures and kathas. Nice place to visit for 4 - 7 days.

title: An ashram to live by
review: The picture shown here is of the Beatles ashram, unless it is known as swarg ashram also. But the real swarg ashram is a place where you can stay and is close by. Do not go by the picture: it is of one of the pods built that can be seen on the ruins of the Beatles ashram.

title: Attracton
review: Its a great place of attraction and peace. I visited recently this ashram and its great to find the peace and harmony with in.

title: Beatles Ashram
review: I wrote a blog post about my latest visit. Loved the offbeat location, the graffiti and the serenity.

title: Peaceful Environment all around
review: Swarg Ashram is one of the Peaceful place in Haridwar. It is beauty of its own. Amazing place for Meditation.

title: Swargashram
review: Whole area is named as Swargashram. Actually area is situated on left bank of Ganga river. In older days there was no roads and Sri Badrinath n Kedarnath Yatra was only possible through on foot and here is start of Yatra . Rishikesh as its name was place of rishi’s and from here hills journey start. Swargashram is connected through Laxman Jhoola. For these travellers people used to stay in Dharamshala’s and way to Swarg is later called Swargashram. Rishikesh is in district Dehradun, whereas Swargashram is in Pauri district.

title: Short Trip
review: Comfortable stay. Amazing view. Beutiful atmosphere. Fabulous place for spiritual retreat. Thanks to Guruji for his best of knowledge of Yoga and kind services.

title: Interesting and beautiful place!
review: Loved it here and really enjoyed looking at the architecture and art on the walls. Learnt a lot and enjoyed it much much more than I was expecting to. Worth the journey.

title: Maharshi Mahesh Yogi Ashram, Shankaracharya.
review: This contains a very misleading wrong information. Place and caves shown belong to Maharshi Mahesh Yogi Ashram, Shankaracharya.

title: Swarg Ashram
review: Swarg Ashram, a dense-knit complex of cafes, shops and ashrams, is a popular spot in Rishikesh. India

title: the oldest asrham in rishikesh "international yoga and meditation soceity"
review: best yoga classes clean hygienic and spacious rooms with attached toilet with garden and big yoga hall and 200 hour teacher training classes.

title: Beatles Ashram
review: Now known as the Beatles Ashram, if you've been around more than 5 minutes you'll probably know who the Beatles are, 'The Fab Four'. Love this place, amazing to know your walking the same paths of the iconic Beatles

title: awesome ashram
review: it is very big ashram near ram jhula.you can capture some photos with great views. it is now Beatles Ashram. a must visit place in rishikesh

title: Wonderful place
review: Swargashram is basically the group of dharamshalas and temples on the bank of river Ganga near Ramjhula side of Rishikesh . We stayed at Vanprastha ashram at the end of the road . Great place to stay . The Ganga that is just at the entrance of the Ashram . Room rates are quite reasonable and very nice . The ambience is excellent .

title: Oldest Ashram in Rishikesh
review: Swarg Ashram is located just two kilometers away from Lakshman Jhula.  This is one of the oldest and popular ashrams of Rishikesh.  Rishikesh is a spiritual land for Hindus and as such we can see number of yogis and temples around. This Ashram was built in memory of Swami Vishudhanand.also known as Kali Kamli Wala. Several Religious Activities like Chanting Meditation Aarti take place in the Ashram.

title: Quieter part of Rishikesh again spoiled by speeding, tooting motorbikes
review: This area is beautiful to walk around apart from the constant barrage of speeding tooting motorbikes

title: peaceful place
review: if you want peace visit here. it is away from crowded rishikesh. if you will visit here you will not want to come back. very beautiful and peaceful pace. must visit

title: Serene Environment - Truly Heaven - PEACE and FEEL GOOD
review: Swarg Ashram Rishikesh is a great place to experience the serenity and simple living of the ascetics. Used to the modern amenities as we are we can look for Ashram life with basic amenities...Parmarth Ashram, o rVanprasth Ashram - or even Gita Bhawan - all provide good stay rooms with simple hygenic food. Lot of Kathas or religious discourses and Bhajan or hymns all through the day. Roam around in your one dress and sleep freely - living life care free and of course the freshening bath in ice cold , chilled water of Mother Ganga. The Ganga Arti is so mesmerizing and provides a great spiritual touch.

title: huge.....
review: Swarg ashram is again one of the oldest and the biggest ashrams in rishikesh, so much so that most of the land is owned by swarg ashram and the entire area/locality around ram jhula is known as swarg ashram area housing other smaller asrams, shops and  restaurants.

title: True Bliss
review: If you are in Rishikesh for peace of mind to find your inner self, this is place to discover yourself.

title: I love Maharishi's ashram
review: Because I knew Maharishi quite well, I like going to his ashram, even though it hasn't been well preserved. People tend to refer to it as the "Beatle's Ashram", but that's silly as they were only there for a pretty short time and it was never about them. There's still a feeling of peace that permeates the place. Now it's an official attraction and foreigners have to pay a lot to visit. In the past, you either climbed up a path at the back of the ashram to sneak in or paid a bribe to the guards.

title: A large area to explore
review: It is huge by all standards and is worth a stroll through. Lots of foreigners are present too and its a popular place.

title: Curious
review: The location of Google maps is slightly out, so from the road there is an implication that you going to a tiger safari!  This may be more understandable in Hindi, but in English i only see6 the Tigers Game reserve signs

title: Favorite place on the planet
review: Swarg Ashram is a unique area full of ashrams and yoga centers. Babas and sadhus are everywhere .Many shops and cafes to choose from..all very affordable. It is right on the Ganga river and you can walk down the ghats to get to or in the river to swim or pray. It is a special magical spiritual place. Be aware of monkeys. Cows are everywhere but they are friendly.

title: BEATTLES ashram
review: This is where The BEATTLES stayed in Rishikesh, it is deserted, an open art gallery. GReat for pictures

title: Big Ashram
review: It is a big ashram on one side of Ram Jhula. The ashram belongs to Baba kali kamali wale. Though we didn't stay there but one can get a room there in the nominal price.

title: Inner peace
review: you can stay here for inner peace.  Rishikesh in itself is a peaceful place.  you will enjoy staying here.

title: Inner peace .......
review: Stay here for if you are looking for inner piece. Sit on the bank of Ganga. just enjoy the breeze, calmness and stillness of the place.

title: Famous Ashram of Rishikesh
review: Swarg ashram  one of the oldest and the biggest ashrams in rishikesh, Most of the land is  near land is also owned by swarg ashram and the entire area/locality around ram jhula is known as swarg ashram area housing other smaller  shops and restaurants.

title: So worth going to!
review: Had the pleasure of visiting the Swarg Ashram and it was absolutly amazing. Such a treasure tucked away in the forest, it is a definity must see if you are in Rishikesh. The little meditation huts are sprinkled around the grounds and all the other buildings are so unique to see. The art work in the Bettles gallery very unique as well.If they were ever to restore it I would stay there for sure. So majestic!

title: A different experience
review: Went to this ashram after reading reviews at TripAdvisor.. Dont trust GPS and take left before swarga ashram.. Explore as much as you can.. Dont forget to write your own message..

title: Place to descover
review: As the name connotes, it is a beautiful place situated in picturesqe surroundings at the foothills of Himalayas. On the left bank of the Ganges between Rishikesh and Laxmanjhula, Swarg Ashram is the spiritual "ground zero of Rishikesh, filled with a concentration of ashrams and temples. The areas is known for its healthly and satvic living environment.

title: Everything you need in Rishikesh
review: From shopping and restaurants to beaches and ashrams, this is the place! The Best beaches in town are just upriver from Ram Jhula Bridge, and farthest down river is Maharishi's Ashram where the Beatles visited. In between are all the shops, cafes, bathing ghats and hotels that you need for great ganga darshan.

title: Good for shopping
review: My wife enjoyed shopping at Swargashram for souvenirs and some traditional clothing items like kurta material etc.

title: Magical Time Out,GO and Explore!
review: I was lucky enough to have the whole place to myself, exploring all the abandoned buildings, finding great works of art in hidden corners or displayed throughout big open halls. Go and explore, observe, absorb the energy. Meditate for a while and imagine what was and what occurred all those years ago. Away from the hustle and bustle. Make sure to walk further than the green domes, there is so much more my friends-happy adventures to you all.

title: provides best accomodation
review: Baba kali kamli wale is very popular name in rishikesh.This ashram belongs to him.The ashram is quite big and spread over the bank of ramjhoola .They have several hundreds of rooms for the devotees at very nominal rates. Ac, non AC big, small family rooms etc . the rooms are very clean and the ganga view is very spiritual and the flow of water is very peaceful.  So try to stay here once. you will remember it.

title: Extremely overpriced and Nice
review: Lovely to visit the Ashram that the Beatles frequented in the sixties and a bit offensive to be abused and price gouged by local opportunists that feel the need to charge more than the entrance to the Taj Mahal for a visit...

title: Only for curiousity
review: I have been here twice. A few years ago, I was with some friends who have not been to India. We came here and it was already closed to public because it is part of the Rajaji National Forest though it is on the end part, doable to explore. Back then, you have to bribe the guards but sadly, the money goes to the guards, not the government.

title: Nice place with visit with peace
review: Quite nicely maintained and clean place one can visit. To visit, one has to book rooms in advance, which can done at trust's office in Kolkata or over phone followed by sending DD their. Alternatively, when any group is going, you can visit alongwith group. one side is Ganga river bank and other side is entrance . Bank is cemented and quite big with protection to take bath.

title: Sneak in and explore the magic!
review: I was blown away by how awesome this ashram was. So big and all the abandoned buildings are open for you to explore. Worth it but DO NOT PAY THE 600 RS!! Walk towards the Ganga and follow the little road up, into the forest. It's a small hike, but worth it and makes the experience more exciting!

title: Swarg Ashram
review: This is an extremely peaceful place to be in. I did not stay here, but I frequented it and visited the Ganga Aarti they have here... It has a calming effect on your senses. Just sit on the stairs near the shore of Ganga river and let this beautiful spiritual feeling take over your body and your mind!

title: best for stay there
review: good location ,,  early morning there yoga classes available for everyone ,,, and neutral beauty ,, i love that  place ...........................................................

title: A way to heaven.
review: It's a good place to eat n stay. Lots of dharamshalas n small restaurants. U will find many small shops selling gems n crystals.

title: Nice place.
review: Very nice place, you can see how old Sadus used to live in these small, 'homes'. It is surround with Nature, very is peaceful and quiet.

title: A must palce to visit
review: Visiting Swargashram, Rishikesh? Then do not forget to visit the beatle's ashram/Maharishi Mahesh Yogi Ashram. One of the must see place to visit!

title: Peace
review: The meaning of Swarg is heaven and as the name suggests it has peace.

title: Very cool Beatles Ashram
review: Definitely make the trip or walk if you can and they let you in. It is so cool to see the wall art and snoop around in the meditation caves. The place is pretty much a straight path from the bridge, there are details of the things you will pass but you can't go wrong if you go straight.

title: Different world
review: Swargashram is a different world of its own. All on the banks of ganga. People come and stay at ashram for months. Must visit for all seeking peace.

title: Nice, clean place for short/long stays
review: Nice and clean facility in Indian standards  :)

title: not as expected
review: the place was quite dirty, beggars surround you for money and other stuff. expected much more from the place

title: It's a ok "Ganga Ghat"
review: The Ghat(river bank) in front of this hotel is known as Parmarth Niketan ,where you can participate in 'Ganga Aarti' ..a truly Devine experience ....

title: Not as expected
review: The photo is of Parmarth niketan. There are many ashrams are situated at the bank of holy river gange. Before many years there was loneliless and peace but now a days the places are over crowded especialy in Shravan Month.

title: Nice ashram
review: Swarg Ashram is located close to popular Ram Jhula bridge in Rishikesh.Check out the pic which I took from outside while on my way to Ram Jhula. Nice ashram - one of the many in Rishikesh.

title: Nice area for a walk
review: My highlight in this area is this little juice bar with the most amazing, HUGE fruit salad. There are many shops which sell everything from clothes to books and the obligatory grocery shops... but the vibe is different then Laxman Jhula - i liked it there more. But anyway, it´s nice to walk from one side to the other side of town along the Ganges.

title: Swarg Ashram – Fine Place to Stay And Meditate in Rishikesh
review: I reside in Rishikesh at  Swarg Ashram at Ganga Kutir. It's really cost-effective and very comfortable and visiting this place with my family is our routine. I remember visiting this place since I was very young. This place is well-protected by the small hills and gushing rivers nearby and is a good place for relaxing and meditating. I would recommend this place to tourists who are visiting Rishikesh.

title: A serene and peaceful place!
review: First things first...this is a name of the area and not a particular 'ashram' per say! Like everyone else, I also went with an expectation to be an ashram but it there are many small cottages in this areas which are used by the Yogis for their meditation and day to day activities.

title: Peaceful and Devine Place
review: We have Stayed various times at Vanprastha Ashram at Swarg Ashram Rishikesh. There are different types of flats with very resonable rates. The Ashram is surrounded by Hills and protected by boundary wall. It also consists a Mandir , Veg restaurant parks . The ashram has a wide ghat of river Ganga where you can bath and pass your times and enjoy Arati for goddes. We have enjoyed.

title: Nice and budgeted place to stay for 2 or 3 nights
review: Very peaceful place to stay for travelers. It quite in center of demanded market and laxman jhula. I opted this place on my friends recommendation and I think he was quite right about it. I suggest to make as your accommodation for short duration.

title: Swarg Ashram is the name of region
review: Swarg Ashram is the name of region and its has been occupied by several ashrams including 'Ganga Aarti' fame Parmarth Niketan. We stayed at Vanprasth ashram (Baba Kali Kamli Wale Ashram). It is such a beautiful and peaceful place, nobody would like to come back. this ashram offers room/family flats with or without kitchen only to married couple or families with very nominal charges. One can prepare food by themselves or can get food from 'Aahaar Sthala' inside Ashram. For those who are seeking a peaceful place must visit this ashram. Booking can be done earlier through phone call.

title: A holy visit
review: This Ashram has been built by the Birla's.The temple inside the Swarg Ashram has very beautiful Vishnu Lakshmi idols that make the whole place very divine and spiritual. The complex also has an accredited shop for semi-precious stones and Rudraksh. The authenticity of the stones is shown though a machine making it reliable outlet. I myself purchased a sphatik  bracelet and a manak stone from this outlet.

title: ASHRAMS
review: the place is nt gud fr youngesters but u should go one time to see the place.peaceful place. u can get the rooms there.u can also see their garden too its pretty gud.

title: Peaceful adobe along the banks of ganges
review: It's the most peaceful place in India. Ganges in its pristine white.

title: Warm and peaceful, authentic stays
review: I have stayed here through meditation courses with crowds of friends and on solo personal trips. The energy emerging from this old place is calming and peaceful, INSPIRation, words go when the mind calms, eh? Ann G.

title: Meditation spirituality and peace
review: Rishikesh undoubtedly is the spiritual capital of northern India , sadhu sanyasis (sages and saints ) aashrams and temples, seekers of spirituality will find everything here . Swargashram is the place to visit in Rishikesh with its plethora of temples ashrams meditation centres and now message centres.

title: divine
review: for all those peacelovers, rishikesh is the ideal place to visit, away from all the hustle bustle...relaxing times with your friends and family mixed with spirituality..

title: Such a peaceful place
review: Loved the trees, shrubs and peace gardens.  Liked the fact there was a path close by where you could trek to  Neelkanth Temple - wish I had more time to be able to do this.

title: Heaven on Earth.......
review: With Ganga ji on one side with full flow, always round the year and the small street in Rishikesh is just fantabulous.......The evening  Ganga ji Aarti in front of the Parmarth Ashram is worth a view and feel. The young pandits and yuva charya's are doing a wonderful job in the Aarti performed Daily around 5.30 - 6 PM on the banks of River. Take a Holy Dip and attend the Aarti, its a wonderful experience........

title: Peace
review: Its a nice peaceful place with Ganga passing by. Normally you ll hear all chants and shouting and screaming but this place is silent. Full of trees and gardens

title: a place to find or loose yourself, whichever way you want
review: I like ashrams, people, chai, cows, dogs and ganges, its all, part of bliss. Walkmaround, chat with fellow travelers, hire a bike and explore around, hike, do yoga, meditation its all part of a lovely journey

title: Religious abode-full of ashrams
review: Other side of River Ganga (Left Bank). Can be reached here by four wheeler via Chilla Barrage. Or by walking over Ram Jhula or by steamer across  (every TEN minutes) the banks.

title: Amazing arti
review: Atmosphere, the chants, the Ganges at my feet.

title: Very interesting
review: Strolling around amongst pelgrims, seeing the ashrams, the ghats and the temples, all not to be missed out when you are in Rishikesh. That is mainly why you are there.

title: do visit and feel the place to feel rishikesh
review: walk around feel the place , feel the atmosphere, observe people, pilgrims, animals at peace;   feel rishikesh. No point writing much, one visits rishikesh for tending to ones religious, spiritual side or what ever. it's different from a routine tourist attraction, rather it is not supposed to be an attraction, because if you are spiritually evolved you have overcome attractions in life. Bye  .

title: Spiritual place
review: walk around feel the place , feel the atmosphere, observe people, pilgrims, animals at peace; feel rishikesh. No point writing much, one visits rishikesh for tending to ones religious, spiritual side or what ever. it's different from a routine tourist attraction, rather it is not supposed to be an attraction,

title: Must visit for every tourist
review: I belong to Rishikesh & use to visit this place since I was a kid.

title: Wonderful spiritual place along the vank of the Holy River Ganga
review: I visited the place and got  inner peace by seeing the work towards humanity and serving people.

title: nice
review: we visit at swargashram and its beautiful place at rishikesh. nice collection of god n goddess n love to stay here maximum time

title: Excellent area to stay in!
review: This is the most beautiful place to stay in Rishikesh, the only drawback is that you cannot roam around late at night as the Ashrams have their rules. Apart from this the place is ideal for staying, the people in Ashrams are very helpful and the market area is really close by.

title: Peace
review: Peaceful Stay. Best Place to do nothing and dip in nature. Have a ayurvedic massage, sit on the ghats, Visit the Aarti and Parmarth Niketan Ashram

title: Great area to visit
review: The Arti at Parmarth Ashram well worth a visit at 6pm daily on the banks of the River Ganga.  There is music and singing and candle lighting and many people put offerings of small bowls of flowers, candle and incense.  Sometimes the Swamiji is there and he personally sings and yes it does include some Hari Krishna.

title: Good place to stay long time, do yoga and enjoy being there
review: Swarg Ashram is perhaps the oldest ashram in Rishikesh. It is located in the center of Ram Jhula, right at the bank of Mother Ganga, at the foothills of the "jungly" Himalayas. The best place to stay in for a long time is definitely Akash Ganga and Ganga Niwas. Most probably, they'll deny you a room as they are permanently booked by long-timers of Rishikesh. These folks definitely know good places. In the heart of Swarg Ashram, there's a big yoga school, Himalayan Yoga Academy. While staying in one of their guesthouses, you can join a drop-in class or an intensive course in yoga. I totally recommend this to anyone. The ashram hosts a cow farm and a school for children from under-resourced families. You can walk around and observe stray cows, fake saddhus (orange-camouflaged drug dealers looking like mojaheds), meditate on the beach. All in one solution for those visiting Rishikesh for yoga.

title: Spiritual India
review: Real India, spiritual atmosphere. Not as many tourists as Laxsman jule so felt more genuine. loved it

title: Peaceful
review: We were told, you can stay here with family for free (donation upto you). Basic rooms with cooking facility and utensils. Otherwise thali available for Rs 25 per person.

title: graced by the elderly
review: A place where one can come and live when one loses all worldly desires and there is nothing to look forward while the thoughts of afterlife take over . peaceful

title: Sanctuary
review: Wonderful peaceful besides for monmeys playing out side the door in the morning. Great big rooms, hoping they will install a burner for cooking, that would be awesome

title: mystic place
review: magic atmosphere, i suggets you to try a banana or chocolate samosa at the office, the place to go for a good breakfast

title: best ashram in rishikesh
review: its ideally located on the otherside of ganga river, its quite big, you can walk to the river from the rooms, bath/swim can be had there,

title: Nice place to stay.........Peaceful, pictureseque,
review: This place if good place to stay for a couple of days to enjoy the peaceful environment.

title: The heart of Rishikesh
review: Shops, ashrams, restaurants, sadhus, beggars dressed like sadhus, the riverside trail to Lakshman Jhula. It's all here.

title: Undoubtedly an heritage !!
review: As this is on the way to Ram-jhula, everybody goes through this place. Very old temples indeed, good for peace of soul.

title: Surreal!
review: The ashram is very peaceful. The best part is the Arti by the riverside in the evening @5.30pm. Its surreal and transports you into another world. The bhajans and arti in front of the flowing waters is something not to be missed

title: Peaceful Area good for Yoga
review: The area is very good as mostly roads are not allowed for vehicle. Good place to stay for tourist for learning Yoga as surrounding area is Clean, Quite. There is a Famous daily Ganga Ceremony near Clock Tower.

title: So Nice Place
review: Swargashram is the epicenter of all yoga and meditation centers in Rishikesh. Swarg Ashram offers hundreds of rooms and hall with facilities.

title: Ultimate place for spiritual growth
review: I visited my grandmother who lives here for 4 months. It's a nice place to sit and meditate by the Ganges. The ghats are clean, and so is the river. You can easily bathe from here without crowds. The evening Ganga Aarti is worth attending at least once in your lifetime. All food here is vegetarian, with many cafes serving international flavours. You can visit saints and listen to lectures and kathas. Nice place to visit for 4 - 7 days.

title: An ashram to live by
review: The picture shown here is of the Beatles ashram, unless it is known as swarg ashram also. But the real swarg ashram is a place where you can stay and is close by. Do not go by the picture: it is of one of the pods built that can be seen on the ruins of the Beatles ashram.

title: Beatles Ashram
review: I wrote a blog post about my latest visit. Loved the offbeat location, the graffiti and the serenity.

title: Attracton
review: Its a great place of attraction and peace. I visited recently this ashram and its great to find the peace and harmony with in.

title: Peaceful Environment all around
review: Swarg Ashram is one of the Peaceful place in Haridwar. It is beauty of its own. Amazing place for Meditation.

title: Short Trip
review: Comfortable stay. Amazing view. Beutiful atmosphere. Fabulous place for spiritual retreat. Thanks to Guruji for his best of knowledge of Yoga and kind services.

title: Swargashram
review: Whole area is named as Swargashram. Actually area is situated on left bank of Ganga river. In older days there was no roads and Sri Badrinath n Kedarnath Yatra was only possible through on foot and here is start of Yatra . Rishikesh as its name was place of rishi’s and from here hills journey start. Swargashram is connected through Laxman Jhoola. For these travellers people used to stay in Dharamshala’s and way to Swarg is later called Swargashram. Rishikesh is in district Dehradun, whereas Swargashram is in Pauri district.

title: Interesting and beautiful place!
review: Loved it here and really enjoyed looking at the architecture and art on the walls. Learnt a lot and enjoyed it much much more than I was expecting to. Worth the journey.

title: Wonderful place
review: Swargashram is basically the group of dharamshalas and temples on the bank of river Ganga near Ramjhula side of Rishikesh . We stayed at Vanprastha ashram at the end of the road . Great place to stay . The Ganga that is just at the entrance of the Ashram . Room rates are quite reasonable and very nice . The ambience is excellent .
